FILE 2: manifest.json

Copy and paste this:

json
{
  "name": "Salama - AI Care Companion",
  "short_name": "Salama",
  "description": "AI-powered care companion for elderly and caregivers",
  "start_url": "/",
  "display": "standalone",
  "background_color": "#0d9488",
  "theme_color": "#0d9488",
  "orientation": "portrait",
  "icons": [
    {
      "src": "logo.png",
      "sizes": "512x512",
      "type": "image/png",
      "purpose": "any maskable"
    }
  ]
}

FILE 3: service-worker.js

Copy and paste this:

javascript
const CACHE_NAME = 'salama-v1';
const urlsToCache = [
  '/',
  '/index.html',
  '/manifest.json',
  '/logo.png'
];

self.addEventListener('install', event => {
  event.waitUntil(
    caches.open(CACHE_NAME)
      .then(cache => cache.addAll(urlsToCache))
  );
});

self.addEventListener('fetch', event => {
  event.respondWith(
    caches.match(event.request)
      .then(response => response || fetch(event.request))
  );
});

FILE 4: logo.png

Save your Salama logo image (the teal one with white text and branches) as logo.png in the same folder.

STEP 2: Upload to GitHub

  1. Go to github.com and log in
  2. Click the "+" button (top right) ‚Üí "New repository"
  3. Repository name: salama-app
  4. Make it Public
  5. DON'T check "Add a README file"
  6. Click "Create repository"
  7. On the next page, you'll see options. Click "uploading an existing file" (it's a link in the text)
  8. Drag and drop ALL 4 files into the upload area:
    • index.html
    • manifest.json
    • service-worker.js
    • logo.png
  9. Scroll down and click "Commit changes" (green button)

STEP 3: Enable GitHub Pages

  1. In your repository, click the "Settings" tab (top menu)
  2. Scroll down the left sidebar and click "Pages"
  3. Under "Source", select "Deploy from a branch"
  4. Under "Branch", select "main" (or "master")
  5. Keep the folder as "/ (root)"
  6. Click "Save"
  7. Wait 2-3 minutes for deployment

STEP 4: Get Your Link

After 2-3 minutes, refresh the Pages settings page. You'll see:

Your site is live at https://YOUR-GITHUB-USERNAME.github.io/salama-app/

Copy that link! That's your app! üéâ

STEP 5: Install on Your Phone

iPhone:

  1. Open Safari (must use Safari, not Chrome)
  2. Go to your link: https://YOUR-USERNAME.github.io/salama-app/
  3. Tap the Share button (box with arrow)
  4. Scroll down and tap "Add to Home Screen"
  5. Name it "Salama"
  6. Tap "Add"
  7. Done! Check your home screen!

Android:

  1. Open Chrome
  2. Go to your link: https://YOUR-USERNAME.github.io/salama-app/
  3. Tap the three dots menu (top right)
  4. Tap "Add to Home screen" or "Install app"
  5. Name it "Salama"
  6. Tap "Add"
  7. Done! Check your home screen!

STEP 6: Share with Others

Just send them your link:

https://YOUR-GITHUB-USERNAME.github.io/salama-app/

They can:

  • Open it in their browser
  • Add it to their home screen
  • Use it like a real app

TROUBLESHOOTING

If the app doesn't load:

  • Make sure all 4 files are uploaded
  • Check that logo.png is actually named logo.png (not logo.PNG or logo (1).png)
  • Wait 5 minutes after enabling GitHub Pages
  • Try clearing your browser cache

If the logo doesn't show:

  • Make sure the logo file is named exactly logo.png
  • Try re-uploading it

If it doesn't work offline:

  • The service worker needs time to cache files
  • Use the app once while online
  • Then it will work offline

UPDATING THE APP LATER

When you want to make changes:

  1. Go to your repository on GitHub
  2. Click on the file you want to edit
  3. Click the pencil icon (Edit)
  4. Make your changes
  5. Click "Commit changes"
  6. Wait 2-3 minutes
  7. Refresh your phone app

üéâ YOU'RE DONE!

That's it! You now have:

  • ‚úÖ Salama as a real web app

NEXT: Create Your Files

Create a folder called salama-app and put these 3 files in it:

1. Save the code you just copied as: app.js

html
<!DOCTYPE html>

    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes">

</head>
<body>
    <div id="root"></div>
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react@18/umd/react.production.min.js"></script>
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react-dom@18/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"></script>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/@babel/standalone/babel.min.js"></script>
    <script type="text/babel" src="app.js"></script>
    <script>
        if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('service-worker.js');
        }
    </script>
</body>
</html>

3. Create manifest.json:

json
{
  "name": "Salama",
  "short_name": "Salama",
  "start_url": "/",
  "display": "standalone",
  "background_color": "#0d9488",
  "theme_color": "#0d9488",
  "icons": [{
    "src": "logo.png",
    "sizes": "512x512",
    "type": "image/png"
  }]
}

4. Create service-worker.js:

javascript
const CACHE = 'salama-v1';
self.addEventListener('install', e => {
  e.waitUntil(caches.open(CACHE).then(cache => 
    cache.addAll(['/', '/index.html', '/app.js', '/logo.png'])
  ));
});
self.addEventListener('fetch', e => {
  e.respondWith(caches.match(e.request).then(r => r || fetch(e.request)));
});

5. Add your logo.png file to the folder
